derivation: a primitive root; also  denominative (from H2779 (חֹרֶף))
outline:
1. to reproach, taunt, blaspheme, defy, jeopardise, rail, upbraid
    1. (Qal) to reproach
    2. (Piel) to reproach, defy, taunt
  2. (Qal) to winter, spend harvest time, remain in harvest time
  3. (Niphal) to acquire, be betrothed
kjv_def: betroth, blaspheme, defy, jeopard, rail, reproach, upbraid.
strongs_def: to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
